concept_definition: forming a curved line around a central point so that all points on the line are equidistant from that center; round in shape
the forward-facing part or position
the highest point or part
the outer boundary or margin of something
a long narrow mark or band; a row of people or things
the center point or position
a hollow place or opening
the external form or outline of something
a place where two surfaces meet; an angle
a small round mark; a particular place
the outer edge of something circular
the middle point of something
a plane figure with four equal straight sides and four right angles
a plane figure with four straight sides and four right angles, especially one with unequal adjacent sides
a plane figure with three straight sides and three angles
a three-dimensional solid object bounded by six equal square faces
a round three-dimensional solid figure in which every point on the surface is equidistant from the center
a three-dimensional solid or hollow object with straight parallel sides and circular ends
a three-dimensional geometric shape that tapers from a flat circular base to a point called the apex
a three-dimensional structure with a polygonal base and triangular sides that meet at a point
a plane figure with six straight sides and six angles
a plane figure with five straight sides and five angles
a plane figure with eight straight sides and eight angles
